data.title: Rude
data.text: Rude , small, dark, not a friendly atmosphere. Has an ok  selection if sweets.  The breakfast was poor.

data.title: Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.
data.text: Nice atmosphere.  The food was good but nothing special.  They do have happy hour from 5-7 that i enjoyed.

data.title: Not up to Kimpton standards
data.text: I have stayed at a lot of Kimpton's and usually they deliver great food. Not so much at Hotel Rouge. The Bar Rouge is very cozy and has a cool vibe but the food is what you might expect from Appleby's, not Kimpton. Skip it and go around the corner for a real meal, then come back for drinks.

data.title: Very drafty
data.text: We only went to the bar once to get a glass of wine.  It was small and empty.  Not one of the liveliest spots in town.

data.title: Interesting drinks, good food.
data.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Rouge and we visited their bar, Bar Rouge, on 2 occasions.  The drinks on their menu are interesting and creative, and the bar food was good as well.  We had the truffled fired and hot wings - excellent comfort food.  Service was good and the music was very Euro-trendy.  Overall, we had a great time.

data.title: Quiet, but great cocktails
data.text: This was a nice find on a quiet street in central DC. Great selection of cocktails. Only one member of staff working, so she was a little run off her feet.

data.title: nice staff, good snacks!
data.text: love the wings! always lovely staff. patient and perfect for happy hour with that free wine at 5pm and never overcrowded

data.title: Average to poor food at best
data.text: Not up to Kimpton standards. You would think with a very limited menu they would do the things on it well. They don't. Skip this place and fight someplace near by that is better

data.title: Modern yet Retro
data.text: Very interesting seating, cozy ambiance, - good breakfast served in bar (eggs, has browns, toast)  - was $12, which was a fair price to dine in DC.

data.title: Even the locals come here
data.text: Very good happy hour!  Stylish and sexy atmosphere.  The servers are super attentive, quick, and friendly.

data.title: Great wine and cocktails
data.text: the bartender was amazing and gave us a supper good dirty dirty dirty martini! Love the wine hour as well!

data.title: OK for a quick drink, not a destination
data.text: Not much of a vibe. Fine to grab a drink if you're staying at the property. Very friendly bartender.

data.title: too narrow and noisy
data.text:
the bar is just too long too narrow and full of not very polite people.
this bar need a renovation and redesign so visitors can feel more comfortable when asking for a drink is super difficult to reach the bartender

data.title: Business trip late night drink & snack
data.text: I wasn't here long; just wanted some food & a drink before going to bed (staying at the Rouge Hotel). So my POV isn't very broad but this place was just lovely - by my 'average' rating I mean you should totally go if you're here (nothing spectacular to go out of the way for, it's not close to much). I had french onion soup & 2 cocktails. Both were very good. The guy next to me seemed to like his sandwich. The bartender was really nice and conversational (Charisma - her name and personality). It's a great hotel bar, average bar overall.

data.title: Nice decorations and music
data.text:
The atmosphere is upbeat and modern.  The unique and edgy decoration adds a touch of personality to the bar.

The dinner tastes great with decent services.  The breakfast is simple but hearty.  However, there is only one waiter/waitress to serve the tables.  Maybe it is a little bit under-staffed.

data.title: Wine Reception lead to tasty snacks
data.text:
Not a huge menu but a tasty one, with a hipster flair to go with the decor. We liked the appetizers and craft cocktails. 
We did not partake, but breakfast smelled delicious.

data.title: Nice atmosphere, good value, weird seats
data.text: They have a nice appetizer menu, good value for drinks, nice but small space.  Some of the chairs are oversized, very strange for a bar--rather like a kasbah in Morocco...  If you are staying in the hotel Rouge, it's a good diversion, but if not, I'm not sure it's worth a stop.  Very pleasant staff--it doubles as the breakfast space in the morning.

data.title: Great staff
data.text: The Bar Rouge is a small intimate bar in the Rouge Hotel.  It was a nice place to relax after a long day.  The staff was attentive and very pleasant.

data.title: Love it!
data.text: Super cute and chic and also elegant, great drinks, great staff and food is yummy. Worth the price. The girl who is there is super friendly and professional, she can advice you in tips to get around the city and other places to visit. The music is also great, awesome environment overall.

data.title: Inadequate tables for dining
data.text:
Two mornings we tried to have breakfast (during early March, certainly not high season) but each time no tables could accommodate us, while the limited larger tables were taken often by just one person. Seating not managed well by staff. Small oval tables along the benches are more suited to drinking than dining. Better if they had square or rectangular tables that could be pulled together to accommodate three or four people.  I wish I could comment on the food but on both mornings we were there we never had the opportunity to discover it. Too bad, the menu looked good and the prices looked reasonable for a hotel. 

We found breakfast elsewhere; we ended up really enjoying Petit Quotidien, at both the F Street and Dupont Circle locations.
